title: How to Know if Your Nintendo Account is Suspended or Banned

steps.title: Unlock your Switch.
steps.content: Unlock your Switch. In most cases, you'll need to click any button three times. Nintendo will ban your online account and/or console if you breach the user agreements with activities such as fraudulent transactions, jailbreaking your Switch, downloading mods to your Switch, hacking, and more. [1] X Research source Similar to getting banned on Twitter , Instagram , or Tiktok , the extent of the violation will determine if your account is suspended or permanently banned.

steps.title: Select Nintendo eShop.
steps.content: Select Nintendo eShop . This looks like a yellow shopping bag icon. If you have multiple user accounts on your Switch, select the account you want to check.

steps.title: Check for access.
steps.content: Check for access. If you can access the Nintendo eShop, your account is not banned. You'll be able to purchase digital copies of games and play online without any restrictions. If you are suspended, you'll see the message: "This account has been suspended due to a violation of the Nintendo Account User Agreement." If you are permanently banned, you'll see the error code 2124-4007 or 2124-4508 along with the message: "The use of online services on this console is currently restricted by Nintendo." [2] X Research source To appeal against this decision, contact Nintendo's Consumer Assistance Hotline at 1-800-255-3700. [3] X Research source Factory resetting the Switch won't remove the ban, so you must contact Nintendo or settle on using the Switch offline with physical cartridges. [4] X Research source
